reviews.text:
A small local railway station 🚉 that serves the public in Sandhurst. Unfortunately there is no main  ticket 🎫 office, so U'll have to buy your ticket 🎫 on the train 🚉.
There is nobody to help anyone with a disability (I.e wheelchairs or any other disability).
There is two platforms with small seating with decent sized cover.
Don't leave your bike. Had two locks on it and the both got cut.
A basic railway station on the scenic North Downs Line. Loco hauled passenger trains pass through occasionally.
You can avoid this if you get the fast train.

NB. Tickets purchased on train. Access extremely difficult for wheelchair users.

Long wait betweens trains during off-peak hours. Small covered waiting areas on both platforms with only a handful of seats of the angled type so you have to exert a fair bit of effort to stop yourself sliding off (handles thoughtfully provided). VERY narrow platforms with steep sloping access - not the safest or easiest for wheelchair users.
